thread.title: Eagles signing WR Alshon Jeffery to one-year deal
thread.title_full: Eagles signing WR Alshon Jeffery to one-year deal

author: Zach Berman
title: Eagles signing WR Alshon Jeffery to one-year deal
text:
Eagles signing WR Alshon Jeffery to one-year deal Updated: March 9, 2017 — 4:17 PM EST 212 Share Eagles signing wide receiver Torrey Smith 
Jeffery, 27, is a boon for the Eagles. The two-time Pro Bowl receiver was the top free agent on the market and gives the Eagles a No. 1 wide receiver. 
Although he has not had a 1,000-yard season since 2014 because of injury and suspension, a short-term deal gives Jeffery a chance to rebuild his value. Jeffery had 52 catches for 821 yards and two touchdowns in 12 games last season; he missed four games because he was suspended for a performance-enhancing drugs. 
For the Eagles, they get a 6-foot-3, 218-pound receiver who is one of the NFL’s best when he’s on the field. He also has familiarity with new wide receivers coach Mike Groh, who was Jeffery’s position coach during Jeffery’s two best seasons: 2013, when Jeffery had 89 catches for 1,421 yards and seven touchdowns; and 2014, when he had 85 catches for 1,133 yards and 10 touchdowns. 
More to come. March 9, 2017 — 4:15 PM EST | Updated: March 9, 2017 — 4:17 PM EST The Philadelphia Inquirer Do you have a minute?...
